Description: Specifies an ephemeral storage request for the container.
Specifies an ephemeral storage limit for the container.
Contains the information about the LDAP user and password for components.
By default all the components create ingress and routes with required annotations. In case any custom annotation is needed for the environment, use this parameter to specify the annotations.
If you create a tls secret, use this parameter to specify it for IBM Content Navigator. Otherwise the operator creates one for you.
If you create a ca secret, use this parameter to specify it for IBM Content Navigator. Otherwise the operator creates one for you.
The architecture for your environment.
How many Content Platform Engine replicas to deploy.
The repository to use.
The specific tag for your release.
The pull policy for the image.
The format for workload logging.
Specifies a CPU request for the container.
Specify a memory request for the container.
Specify a CPU limit for the container.
Specify a memory limit for the container.
Specify whether to enable auto scaling.
The upper limit for the number of pods that can be set by the autoscaler. Required.
The lower limit for the number of pods that can be set by the autoscaler. If it is not specified or negative, the server will apply a default value.
The target average CPU utilization (represented as a percent of requested CPU) over all the pods. If it is not specified or negative, a default autoscaling policy is used.
Specify the host of the mail session.
Added in node selector match expressions. It accepts array list inputs. You can assign multiple selector match expressions except (kubernetes.io/arch).
Note: This can be overwritten by the component level definition, for example navigator_configuration.node_affinity.custom_node_selector_match_expression.
Values in this field are used as annotations in all generated pods. They must be valid annotation key-value pairs.
Values in this field are used as labels in all generated pods. They must be valid label key-value pairs.
Specify the port to use with the mail session host.
For sender, enter a user that has access to the email server to log on.
Specify whether SSL is enabled.
The behavior of startup probes to know when the container is started.
The period in seconds.
The timeout setting in seconds.
The threshold number for failures.
Set the environment variables.
The name of the custom configmap.

Note that, a configmap can hold files or environment data but it cannot a mix of both. The volume_path is optional for a configmap that holds files as its data. If a volume_path is not specified, the files is mounted to the Liberty configuration (cfgstore) mapped location. If the configmap data holds environment variables then must set is_env to true.
The location you want to hold files in.
Specify whether the config map holds environment variables.
The time zone for the container deployment.
Customized font path for multi-language support. You need to place all used font files into this path
The initial use of available memory.
The maximum percentage of available memory to use.
Optionally specify JVM arguments using comma separation. For example:
jvm_customize_options="-Dmy.test.jvm.arg1=123,-Dmy.test.jvm.arg2=abc,-XX:+SomeJVMSettings,XshowSettings:vm"
If needed, you can use DELIM to change the character that is used to separate multiple JVM arguments. In this example, a semi-colon is used to separate the JVM arguments:
jvm_customize_options="DELIM=;-Dcom.filenet.authentication.wsi.AutoDetectAuthToken=true;-Dcom.filenet.authentication.providers=ExShareUmsInternal,ExShareIbmId,ExShareGID"
Name for the Navigator JNDI datasource.
Schema for IBM Content Navigator.
Table space for IBM Content Navigator.
It is recommended not to change this setting.
Specify whether to use the built-in monitoring capability.
Specify whether to use the built-in logging capability.
The persistent volume claim for IBM Content Navigator configuration.
Required: Yes, if you want to use existing PVC

Description: The persistent volume claim for IBM Content Navigator logs.
Required: Yes, if you want to use existing PVC

Description: The persistent volume claim for the plug-ins.
Required: Yes, if you want to use existing PVC

Description: The persistent volume claim for the viewer cache.
Required: Yes, if you want to use existing PVC

Description: The persistent volume claim for the viewer log.
Required: Yes, if you want to use existing PVC

Description: The persistent volume claim for Aspera®.
Required: Yes, if you want to use existing PVC

Description: The period in seconds.
The timeout setting in seconds.
The threshold number for failures.
The period in seconds.
The timeout setting in seconds.
The threshold number for failures.
The secrets to be able to pull images.
Required: Yes, only if you want to override the comparable setting in the shared configuration section.

Description: Set to false if your deployment requires FIPS enablement. The value of the parameter should be consistent with the value of ecm_configuration.disable_fips parameter.
Optional entry only if you have the open_id_connect_providers enabled. Enabling this will give the user the option to sign-in using the LDAP.
